page.title: 042nd DEVELOPMENT SKELMORLIE
page.content: While the end of the 2nd World War brought an end to the servant filled life of the rich,it also brought about a rapid expansion of Skelmorlie. During the Blitz of Greenock in 1941 many people fled to the surrounding villages and spent the remainder of the war years there as refugees.At the end of the war many of these families wanted to stay on in Skelmorlie and houses to rent were built to accommo- date them.The local authority housing grew. There was not much employment in Skelmorlie and people travelled to Greenock and Glasgow to work. Skelmorlie was becoming a dormitory village.
